data.meta_description:
Could you be our next Chief Executive Officer?

We're looking for an  energetic, hardworking, articulate, determined & inspirational leader with experience of‚Ä¶
data.text:
Three reasons why you might want to consider a fractional COO. Depending on the scale of your organization, certain leadership positions may be beyond your reach. That's where fractional leadership can play a role. In the blog linked here I explore a few reasons why you might consider that option. I have leveraged this approach as a firm leader in the past and am currently serving in a fractional leadership capacity today. What is less clear to me, is how to match people with the skills and experience to the firms that need them. I am a big fan of, and often make referrals but I'm not sure that's the only solution. If you have experience, insight or just thoughts on how to best make these connections, please share your thoughts in the comments.

Dear Executives, Sharing is Caring! Share your expertise! Now! As executive leaders and the next potential CEOs , it's important to give back to your network. Share insights, industry news, and other helpful resources and views of yours that will benefit your connections and those who take you as their ideal and inspirational role model. Not only does this build goodwill, but it also establishes you as a thoughtful leader in your field. Don‚Äôt restrict yourself preaching the motto ‚Äúevery employee is a sales person‚Äù. Do it! ‚úÖSell your experience, ‚úÖSell your observations, ‚úÖSell your accomplishments, ‚úÖSellyour philosophies, ‚úÖSell your justifications‚Ä¶‚Ä¶!!!! Sharing is Caring !

Join me and Ona Alston Dosunmu, Sharon Kneebone, IOM, FASAE, CAE, Cynthia Young, CAE. [she/her], and Grant Carpenter for an insightful discussion on March 14th. https://t.ly/JXg7g Are you stepping into the dynamic world of leading as a first-time CEO, Executive Director, or Secretary-General? The job of the chief staff executive (CSE) can be demanding under any circumstances. Navigating the uncharted waters as you take on the role for the first time in your career will be exhilarating and yet can also be particularly hard. Maybe you‚Äôre following in the footsteps of a long-term and beloved leader, or perhaps being brought in during times of crisis or downturn to ‚Äúclean house‚Äù and turn things around? Maybe you're the pioneer, serving as an organization‚Äôs first paid chief staff executive as it transitions from being founder-led to founder-inspired? This panel of successful chief staff executives will share priceless lessons learned that are perfect for anyone newly appointed or aspiring to the top spot. Let's unpack the professional and personal challenges, rewards, and surprises they encountered‚Äîincluding some that are not often discussed. Find out what they wished they‚Äôd known before taking on their roles, what surprised them, and what sustains them in their work. #leadership #representationmatters #ceo #assnchat #asae

Being a Non-Executive Director is different from being an Executive Director and some first-time Directors take longer than others to make the switch between executive and non-executive ways of thinking and behaving. Most understand at an intellectual level that they will need to approach their Board responsibilities in a different way from their executive role, yet underestimate how difficult this transition is in practice. As a Non-Executive Director you exercise power through influence.

Public Practice Managers, don't tick along with the status quo. Now is the time to strategically position yourself in the right business, leadership team and environment. Don't wait and see, take control and make sure you achieve what you've set out to do. If you are feeling stuck at your current practice or maybe you've hit the ceiling, there has never been a better time to explore career opportunities. I can't believe how many excellent leadership opportunities have come up in the past week for Business Advisory & Tax. Another one today, the third this week, reach out to discuss your career plan. 0406 838 067 // harry@trigonconnect.com.au Trigon Connect // Kristen McFarlane
